intro: Ceropegia plicata, commonly known as the zigzagged ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and distinctive, waxy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, often with a unique, intricate structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light. Ceropegia plicata is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
